titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the P. D. Ouspensky Memorial Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 18, 2019 at 07:28

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of reports of meetings of P. D. Ouspensky with his followers in London (1921-1947) and his manuscripts of books and articles in Russian, French, and English. Included are In Search of the Miraculous, New Model of the Universe, and Tertium Organum. Also in the collection are printed copies of Ouspensky's books in various languages, selected articles by others on Ouspensky, and photographs.

langmaterial.language: The collection is primarily in English, with some material in Russian, French, German, Spanish, Finnish, and Portuguese.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are available for research.
In series I, original typescriptsof meeting reports are too fragile to be used. Photostatic copies of these records are available for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright to unpublished materials by P. D. Ouspensky is held by Tatiana Nagro. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: P. D. Ouspensky Memorial Collection (MS 840). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Tatiana Nagro and others, 1976-1992; gift of Tatiana Nagro, 2000; gift of the Society for the Study of Normal Psychology, 1998; gift of H. W. Kropholler, 2003; gift of William A. Simon, 2003. Gift of Daniel Cerqueiro, 2010.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series and additions: I. Reports of Meetings. II. Writings. III. Writings by Others.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: P. D. Ouspensky was a journalist based in Russia, and travelled extensively in Europe and the Near East. He met George I. Gurdjieff in 1915 and became his follower. Ouspensky broke with Gurdjieff in 1918, left Russia in 1920 and went to Constantinople, and then went to London in 1921 where he founded the Historico-Psychological Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of reports of meetings of P. D. Ouspensky with his followers in London (1921-1947) and his manuscripts of books and articles in Russian, French, and English. Included are In Search of the Miraculous, New Model of the Universe, and Tertium Organum. Also in the collection are printed copies of Ouspensky's books in various languages, selected articles by others on Ouspensky, and photographs.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Writings by others about Ouspensky will no longer be added to the collection as of August 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are too fragile to be used; please use electrostatic copies instead.
